question: Which are the signatory countries of "Camp David Accords"?
option1: United States of America and Union of Soviet Socialist Republics
option4: United States of America and Cuba
explanation: Egypt and Israel were the signatory countries of Camp David Accords. Camp David Accords was a bilateral treaty which involved a pair of political agreements signed by President Anwar Sadat, on the behalf of Egypt and Prime Minister Menachem Begin, on the behalf of Israel, in Camp David, the USA. This lead to the signing of the 1979 Egypt-Israel Peace Treaty.
